newsitem.title: UK: Bank of England to sell 500 mln Ecu notes due 1999.
newsitem.headline: Bank of England to sell 500 mln Ecu notes due 1999.

text.p: The Bank of England said on Tuesday it will sell by tender 500 million Ecu of T-notes due January 26, 1999.
The notes, dated January 23, 1996, will add to the 500 million Ecu of the same security sold by tender on January 16, 1996, the Bank said in a statement.
The Bank said the British government Ecu Treasury notes would be sold for tender on a bid-yield basis on October 15, 1996.

The notes will have an annual coupon of five percent, payable on January 26, from January 26, 1997. "Payment for notes allotted in the tender will be due on October 18, 1996. The amount payable will include 265 days accrued interest," it said.

The Bank also said it will add 50 million Ecu to its holdings of notes available for sale and repurchase operations with market makers, bringing the total available for this purpose to 200 million Ecu.
